objects.name: Analytic 1136
objects.description: Abuse of extended attributes (xattrs) to hide payloads in com.apple.* or custom keys. Defender perspective: monitor suspicious use of xattr command with -w (write) and -p (print) flags, especially when followed by execution of interpreters like bash, Python, or osascript. Behavior chain includes: (1) suspicious file modification with new com.apple.* attributes, (2) attribute content inconsistent with expected metadata tags (e.g., high entropy), (3) subsequent process execution correlated with extraction of the attribute.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: xattr utility execution with -w or -p flags

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Specific xattr keys to monitor (e.g., com.apple.quarantine, com.apple.ResourceFork, unknown custom keys).
High entropy attribute values may indicate encoded or encrypted payloads.
Expected legitimate applications interacting with xattrs (Finder, Spotlight) to help reduce false positives.
